p.s: The author uses communicative strategies in his text to persuade the reader of his opinion.
To be able to persuade the reader more the author tries to also explain the benefits of the unions and tries to come across as unbiased (l. 1-5).
In line two the author uses euphemism to make the reader feel like the kob of the unions are less important than it actually is.
The author achieves this goal by using the word mistreated instead of harassed or a stronger word.
In line five he uses the positively connoted word successful to keep the unbiased or honest image he creates for himself.
He also uses an elaborate and formal language to make it clear that he is an expert in this topic and also to keep the text serious (l. 10) (obstructing) (l. 9-10), (... legislation and laws).

In the last paragraph he makes use of the imperative form and saysays that the govermentgovernment should finally handle this situation which makes the reader think about how serious this topic is (l. 21-22).
With the help of those communicative strategies he makes the reader believe that the unions are not useful at all.
